p: Patients with regular examination after lung cancer surgery can delay the examination if the condition is stable. For advanced lung cancer patients with targeted therapy or immunotherapy, the scheduled examination can be postponed or postponed according to the cancer status. The interval between examinations can be extended to more than 3â€‰months for patients with symptomatic remission or stable disease. It is recommended that patients continue to take the original medication and closely monitor the signs during the postponed examination period. Patients should be examined admitted to the hospital for treatment, if symptoms progressively worsen. And the examination procedures and methods should be simplified to shorten hospital stays. Patients may consult oncologists online or offline to understand the condition after examination.
